summary: This bill, the "Governing Unaccredited Representatives Defrauding VA Benefits Act" or "GUARD VA Benefits Act," aims to reinstate penalties for those charging veterans unauthorized fees related to their claims for benefits administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. It amends Title 38 of the United States Code, specifically Section 5905, to clarify and reinforce the prohibition against unauthorized fees. The bill explicitly prohibits soliciting, contracting for, charging, or receiving fees for benefit claims, with exceptions noted in other sections of the code.
